components

Class BinaryHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • components.BinaryHeap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Heap

    public class BinaryHeap
extends java.lang.Object
implements Heap
    Provides the basic implementation of a binary heap. It contains the typical methods expected from a maximum heap - insertion, returning the maximum value, deleting maximum value and increasing key.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinaryHeap(int heapSize)
      Constructor for the binary heap.

      • returnMax

        public int returnMax()
        Returns the maximum value of the heap.
        Specified by:
        returnMax in interface Heap
        Returns:
        the maximum value located on the first position of the array.

      • deleteMax

        public int deleteMax()
        Deletes the maximum value of the heap and returns it. At the same time subtracts one from the pointer at end of the heap and fixes the heap via the heapify operation. After deletion, if the size of the heap is double or more compared to heapSize, the size of the heap is halved.
        Specified by:
        deleteMax in interface Heap
        Returns:
        the maximum value that was deleted.

      • insert

        public void insert(int newValue)
        Inserts a new value into the heap. Also, adds one to the pointer at the end of the heap and, if necessary, increases the size of the heap (doubles it, to be more precise).
        Specified by:
        insert in interface Heap
        Parameters:
        newValue - the value to be inserted into the heap.

      • heapify

        public void heapify(int[] heap,
                    int index)
        Fixes the heap if it is broken at the given index - "broken" meaning that the key at the given index is smaller than either of its children. The fixing procedure is continued iteratively downwards until the heap is no longer broken.
        Parameters:
        heap - the heap to be fixed.
        index - the index of the node to be checked.

      • increaseKey

        public void increaseKey(int oldValue,
                        int newValue)
        Increases the value of the key in the given node index.
        Parameters:
        oldValue - the old value of the key.
        newValue - the new value of the key.

        public void increaseHeapSize()

      • decreaseHeapSize

        public void decreaseHeapSize()
